summary: Proto-generated PHP files cause Psalm type-checking issues that could be resolved by adding PHP annotations like @psalm-mutation-free and @psalm-assert-if-true to generated getter and hasX methods.
userImpact: Developers working with proto-generated PHP files face false-positive type errors in Psalm that complicate development workflows and reduce confidence in static analysis.
rootCause: Generated proto PHP files lack type-checking annotations that Psalm uses to understand null-safety semantics of hasX() and getX() method pairs.
proposedFix: Add @psalm-mutation-free and @psalm-assert-if-true annotations to generated getter and hasX methods in proto PHP code generator.
keyQuote: That case will be fixed if we add additional annotations in generated files like @psalm-mutation-free and @psalm-assert-if-true
